conversation_summary:
White house, thin walls, daylight cooling.  
Grey tower computer—cables like veins—screen glowing EVIDENCE, tabs, terminal.  
Metal scratch behind drywall, plaster snow.  
Trapdoor opens to ladder of twisted ethernet; basement blooms into root-wired servers pulsing blue.  
Parents flicker in LED silhouettes: “They always find a way.”  
Night bar shortens; footsteps drum above; hard drives tick louder than breath.
